document_title: Laryngeal cancer: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Dr. Hang said that the choice of treatment method will depend on the stage of cancer, location, tumor size and overall health of the patient. Treatments for laryngeal cancer include surgery, radiotherapy and chemotherapy.(4)
Laryngeal cancer that is diagnosed early is often treated with radiation therapy or surgery.
If the cancer is in an advanced stage, the doctor can combine all three methods of surgical removal (part or entire larynx) with lymph node dissection, radiotherapy and chemotherapy to treat the patient.
In case the larynx must be removed, to help the patient restore his voice, the doctor can install a tracheoesophageal vocal valve, practice esophageal voice, or install an electrical device in the throat to create sound.
